key_points: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle did not attend this year's Trooping the Colour ceremony.
The couple recently welcomed their baby girl, Lilibet.
Other notable absences included Kate Middleton and Prince William.
Only two royals attended the event: the Queen and her cousin, Prince Edward, Duke of Kent.
In the past, the event has seen large gatherings of royal family members on the balcony.
Trooping the Colour is known as The Queen's Official Birthday Parade.
COVID-19 restrictions resulted in a scaled-down ceremony this year.
Typically, the event is a grand celebration in central London.
The palace had announced in March about the reduced attendance due to the pandemic.
Consultations with Government and other relevant parties led to the decision to alter the event's traditional format.
